title: Bug 38131ajc needs -d option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling a class in a subpackage using ajc without the -d option, a directory named "subpackage" is created under the existing "subpackage" directory.
EB: The expected behavior is for ajc to have the same behavior as javac and correctly compile the classes from the subpackage without creating an additional "subpackage" directory.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Compile the class using the command: ajc -d subpackage\ Test.java.
3. Verify that the class is compiled correctly and that no additional "subpackage" directory is created.
